meanings.definition: Overcoming or defeating an enemy or obstacle.
meanings.sent1: The conquering of the mountain was a great achievement for the climbers.
meanings.sent2: The conquering of fears is a common theme in many stories.
meanings.sent3: The conquering of the last slice of pizza caused a friendly competition among friends.
meanings.sent4: Her conquering of the chessboard was swift and strategic.
meanings.sent5: The conquering of the final level in the game felt like a major victory.

meanings.definition: Successfully gaining control or mastery over something.
meanings.sent1: She felt a sense of conquering pride after finishing the project.
meanings.sent2: The conquering hero returned to the village with the stolen treasure.
meanings.sent3: The conquering team celebrated their victory with a parade.
meanings.sent4: His conquering spirit led him to overcome all obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The conquering champion raised the trophy high above his head.

meanings.definition: Showing dominance or superiority in a situation.
meanings.sent1: The conquering leader made decisions with confidence and authority.
meanings.sent2: Her conquering presence in the room demanded attention from everyone.
meanings.sent3: The conquering team's victory dance was both impressive and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The conquering lion roared loudly, asserting its dominance over the savannah.
meanings.sent5: His conquering attitude in the debate left no room for doubt about his position.
